name: Espeon
flavorText: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy's actions.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Forretress
flavorText: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside the armor is a total mystery.
Ability1Text: During your opponent's turn, whenever 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon becomes his or her Active Pokemon, Forretress does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working if Forretress is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokemon, then, if you have any Benched Pokemon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)

name: Hitmontop
flavorText: If you become enchanted by its smooth, elegant, dancelike kicks, you may get drilled hard.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Hitmontop.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Houndoom
flavorText: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokemon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.
Attack1Text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom or this attack does nothing.

name: Houndour
flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If there are any Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, choose 1 of them and attach it to Houndour.

name: Kabutops
flavorText: In the water, it tucks its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to Kabutops. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. You can't flip more than 3 coins in this way.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: These Pokemon are attracted to electrical emissions and will often follow people using PokeGear.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, treat any tails flipped when using Magnemite's Electric Bolt attack as if they were heads. (Benching or evolving either Pokemon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

name: Politoed
flavorText: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.
Ability1Text: Whenever Politoed's attack damages the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), if there are more than 3 Poliwags, Poliwhirls, Poliwraths, and/or Politoeds in play (including your opponent's), that attack does 40 more damage (no matter how many heads you get). This power stops working while Politoed is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Poliwrath
flavorText: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.
Attack2Text: Poliwrath does 20 damage to itself.

name: Scizor
flavorText: It swings its eye patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.
Attack1Text: Does damage equal to half the Defending Pokemon's remaining HP (rounded down to the nearest 10).
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Smeargle
flavorText: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon attacked last turn, and Smeargle was in play during that attack, Smeargle copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack.

name: Tyranitar
flavorText: Its body can't be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: For each Benched Pokemon in play (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Umbreon
flavorText: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.

name: Unown [A]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Whenever 1 of your Pokemon with Unown in its name uses its Hidden Power attack, that attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Unown [A]. If you have more than 1 Unown [A] in play, use only 1 [Anger] for each attack.

name: Ursaring
flavorText: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen berries.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Wobbuffet
flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
Attack1Text: If an attack damages Wobbuffet during your opponent's next turn (even if Wobbuffet is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Wobbuffet attacks the Defending Pokemon for an equal amount of damage.

name: Yanma
flavorText: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. Then, if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokemon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Beedrill
flavorText: It can take down any opponent with its powerful poison stingers. It sometimes attacks in swarms.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. Your opponent now puts 3 damage counters on it instead of 1 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Butterfree
flavorText: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now either Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned (your choice).
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon. After doing damage, remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to the amount of damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Espeon
flavorText: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe's next move.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Forretress
flavorText: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.
Ability1Text: During your opponent's turn, whenever 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon becomes his or her Active Pokemon, Forretress does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working if Forretress is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokemon, then, if you have any Benched Pokemon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)

name: Hitmontop
flavorText: If you become enchanted by its smooth, elegant, dancelike kicks, you may get drilled hard.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Hitmontop.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Houndoom
flavorText: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokemon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.
Attack1Text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom or this attack does nothing.

name: Houndour
flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If there are any Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, choose 1 of them and attach it to Houndour.

name: Kabutops
flavorText: In the water, it tucks its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to Kabutops. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. You can't flip more than 3 coins in this way.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: These Pokemon are attracted to electrical emissions and will often follow people using PokeGear.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, treat any tails flipped when using Magnemite's Electric Bolt attack as if they were heads. (Benching or evolving either Pokemon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

name: Politoed
flavorText: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.
Ability1Text: Whenever Politoed's attack damages the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), if there are more than 3 Poliwags, Poliwhirls, Poliwraths, and/or Politoeds in play (including your opponent's), that attack does 40 more damage (no matter how many heads you get). This power stops working while Politoed is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Poliwrath
flavorText: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.
Attack2Text: Poliwrath does 20 damage to itself.

name: Scizor
flavorText: It swings its eye patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.
Attack1Text: Does damage equal to half the Defending Pokemon's remaining HP (rounded down to the nearest 10).
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Smeargle
flavorText: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon attacked last turn, and Smeargle was in play during that attack, Smeargle copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack.

name: Tyranitar
flavorText: Its body can't be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: For each Benched Pokemon in play (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Umbreon
flavorText: When agitated, this Pokemon protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokemon tries to retreat, do 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

name: Unown [A]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Whenever 1 of your Pokemon with Unown in its name uses its Hidden Power attack, that attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Unown [A]. If you have more than 1 Unown [A] in play, use only 1 [Anger] for each attack.

name: Ursaring
flavorText: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen berries.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Wobbuffet
flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
Attack1Text: If an attack damages Wobbuffet during your opponent's next turn (even if Wobbuffet is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Wobbuffet attacks the Defending Pokemon for an equal amount of damage.

name: Yanma
flavorText: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. Then, if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokemon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Corsola
flavorText: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.
Attack1Text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Corsola or this attack does nothing. Remove all damage counters from Corsola.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: Its irregularly configured DNA is affected by its surroundings. It evolves if its environment changes.
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach an Energy card to Eevee, flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee that is the same type as the Energy card you attached to Eevee. Attach that card to Eevee. This counts as evolving Eevee. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Eevee is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Houndour
flavorText: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokemon (before they affect the damage).

name: Igglybuff
flavorText: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that has a Pokemon Power. That power stops working until the end of this turn. This effect ends if that Pokemon leaves the Bench.

name: Kakuna
flavorText: Although it is a cocoon, it can move a little. It can extend its poison barb if it is attacked.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever your opponent's attack damages Kakuna (even if Kakuna is Knocked Out), your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned and Kakuna does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Metapod
flavorText: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it prepares to evolve. It stays motionless in the shell.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 20 or less damage is done to Metapod (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen).
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from Metapod. Then, search your deck for a card that evolves from Metapod and attach that card to Metapod. This counts as evolving Metapod. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Omastar
flavorText: Apparently, it cracked Shellder's shell with its sharp fangs and sucked out the insides.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Water Energy attached to Omastar. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Poliwhirl
flavorText: The swirl on its belly undulates. Staring at it may gradually cause drowsiness.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on Poliwhirl. If this doesn't Knock Out Poliwhirl, search your deck for 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to Poliwhirl. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwhirl but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Pupitar
flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each non-Fighting Pokemon in play. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

name: Scyther
flavorText: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage if exactly 1 is heads, or 20 more damage if exactly 2 are heads, or 40 more damage if exactly 3 are heads, or 80 more damage if all 4 are heads.

name: Unown [D]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Whenever a Darkness Pokemon damages 1 of your Pokemon, reduce that damage by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). This power stops working if you have more than 1 Unown [D] in play. (This power works even if Unown [D] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

name: Unown [F]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [F], Unown [I], Unown [N], and Unown [D] on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Trainer card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Unown [M]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Whenever a Metal Pokemon damages 1 of your Pokemon, reduce that damage by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). This power stops working if you have more than 1 Unown [M] in play. (This power works even if Unown [M] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

name: Unown [N]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Whenever a Colorless Pokemon damages 1 of your Pokemon, reduce that damage by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). This power stops working if you have more than 1 Unown [N] in play. (This power works even if Unown [N] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

name: Unown [U]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [U], Unown [N], Unown [D], and Unown [O] on your Bench, you may return your Active Pokemon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

name: Xatu
flavorText: In South America, it is said that its right eye sees the future and its left eye views the past.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon and 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. Attach that Energy card to that Pokemon.

name: Caterpie
flavorText: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.
Attack1Text: Caterpie does 10 damage to itself.

name: Dunsparce
flavorText: When spotted, this Pokemon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Hoppip
flavorText: Its body is so light, it must grip the ground firmly with its feet to keep from being blown away.

name: Kabuto
flavorText: On rare occasions, some have been found as fossils which they became while hiding on the ocean floor.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card named Kabuto and put it on your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Kabuto as a Basic Pokemon. This power can't be used if Kabuto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed (or if your Bench is full).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, and Kabutops on your Bench.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

name: Mareep
flavorText: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Mareep does 10 damage to itself.

name: Natu
flavorText: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused

name: Omanyte
flavorText: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokemon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Mysterious Fossil and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat that card as a Basic Pokemon. This power can't be used if Omanyte is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed (or if your Bench is full).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Pineco
flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, Pineco does 40 damage to itself and 10 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

name: Poliwag
flavorText: Because it is inept at walking on its newly grown legs, it always swims around in water.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Sentret
flavorText: It stands on its tail so it can see a long way. If it spots an enemy, it cries loudly to warn its kind.
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand.

name: Spinarak
flavorText: It spins a web using fine – but durable – thread. It then waits patiently for prey to be trapped.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Teddiursa
flavorText: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.
Attack2Text: Remove all damage counters from Teddiursa. Teddiursa is now Asleep.

name: Tyrogue
flavorText: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Unown [E]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: When you play Unown [E] from your hand, your opponent may shuffle his or her hand into his or her deck and then draw 4 cards. Either way, you may shuffle your hand into your deck and draw 4 cards.

name: Unown [I]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: When you play Unown [I] from your hand, you may search your deck for a card with Unown in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use this power if your Bench is full.

name: Unown [O]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at 5 cards from the top of your opponent's deck and put them back in the same order.

name: Weedle
flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

name: Wooper
flavorText: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
Attack1Text: If an attack would do damage to Wooper during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, prevent all damage to Wooper from that attack. (Any other effects of that attack happen.)
